fields.name: internalID
fields.description:
Internal immutable identifier for the account. Only visible to Apollo admins (because it really
shouldn't be used in normal client apps).

fields.name: joinToken
fields.description: Token allowing to join the account using mutation{join(accountId:,token:)}}

fields.name: occupiedSeats
fields.description: Number of seats currently allocated to active users

fields.name: seatCountForNextBill
fields.description: How many seats would be included in your next bill, as best estimated today

fields.name: synchronized
fields.description:
A synchronized account tracks its members through an upstream, eg GitHub;
invitations and member removals are only possible on accounts that are not synchronized.

fields.name: acceptedAt
fields.description: An accepted invitation cannot be used anymore

fields.name: acceptedBy
fields.description: Who accepted the invitation

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Time the invitation was created

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: Who created the invitation

fields.name: lastSentAt
fields.description: Last time we sent an email for the invitation

fields.name: deleteChannel
fields.description: Delete an existing channel

fields.name: hardDelete
fields.description: Hard delete an account and all associated services

fields.name: invite
fields.description: Send an invitation to join the account by E-mail

fields.name: refreshBilling
fields.description: Refresh billing information from third-party billing service

fields.name: regenerateJoinToken
fields.description: Set the account-wide invitation token to a new random value

fields.name: removeInvitation
fields.description: Delete an invitation

fields.name: removeMember
fields.description: Remove a member of the account

fields.name: resendInvitation
fields.description: Send a new E-mail for an existing invitation

fields.name: revokeJoinToken
fields.description: Disable the account-wide join token

fields.name: setPlan
fields.description: Set the billing plan

fields.name: terminateSubscriptions
fields.description: Terminate any ongoing subscriptions in the account, without refunds

fields.name: testSlackChannel
fields.description: Test Slack notification channel

fields.name: updateBillingAddress
fields.description: Update the billing address for a Recurly token

fields.name: updateBillingInfo
fields.description: Update the billing information from a Recurly token

fields.name: updateEmail
fields.description: Set the E-mail address of the account, used notably for billing

fields.name: updateID
fields.description: Update the account ID

fields.name: updateName
fields.description: Update the company name

fields.name: updateRecurlyEmail
fields.description: Set the E-mail address in Recurly

fields.name: upsertPagerDutyChannel
fields.description: Create/update PagerDuty notification channel

fields.name: upsertSlackChannel
fields.description: Create/update Slack notification channel

fields.name: clientReferenceId
fields.description: ID, often the name, of the client set by the user and reported alongside metrics

fields.name: clientVersion
fields.description: version of the client set by the user and reported alongside metrics

fields.name: signature
fields.description: first 128 characters of query signature for display

fields.name: dayBeforePublishQueryRequestCount
fields.description: number of requests for affected query during 24 hours before schema publish

fields.name: dayBeforePublishTotalRequestCount
fields.description: total requests for service during 24 hours before schema publish

fields.name: isUpgradeOption
fields.description: Whether this plan is an upgrade option and requires billing information

fields.name: pricePerSeatInUsdCents
fields.description: The price of every seat

fields.name: pricePerUnitInUsdCents
fields.description: The price of subscribing to this plan with a quantity of 1 (currently always the case)

fields.name: public
fields.description: Whether the plan is accessible by all users in QueryRoot.allPlans, QueryRoot.plan, or AccountMutation.setPlan

fields.name: basePriceInUsdCents
fields.description: The price of the subscription when ignoring add-ons (such as seats), ie quantity * pricePerUnitInUsdCents

fields.name: pricePerSeatInUsdCents
fields.description: The price of every seat

fields.name: pricePerUnitInUsdCents
fields.description: The price of every unit in the subscription (hence multiplied by quantity to get to the basePriceInUsdCents)

fields.name: totalPriceInUsdCents
fields.description: Total price of the subscription, including add-ons (such as seats)

fields.name: trialExpiresAt
fields.description:
When this subscription's trial period expires (if it is a trial), according to
the trialPeriodDays flag (not the same as the subscription's Recurly expiration).

types.name: Blob
types.description: A blob (base64'ed in JSON & GraphQL)

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

fields.name: affectedClientIdVersionPairs
fields.description:
Clients affected by change. Each entry is a unique tuple of client reference ID
and version. If clientReferenceId is requested without clientVersion, the result
can have duplicate values

fields.name: affectedClientReferenceIds
fields.description:
IDs of clients affected by change. The client ID can be empty, which is represented
as null

fields.name: argNode
fields.description: Target arg of change made.

fields.name: childNode
fields.description:
Node related to the top level node that was changed, such as a field in an object,
a value in an enum or the object of an interface

fields.name: code
fields.description: Indication of the kind of target and action of the change, e.g. 'TYPE_REMOVED'.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Explanation of both the target of the change and how it was changed.
fields.deprecationReason: generate this string from the code, typeNode, fieldNode, and argNode

fields.name: parentNode
fields.description: Top level node affected by the change

fields.name: severity
fields.description: Indication of the success of the overall change, either failure, warning, or notice.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Indication of the success of the overall change, either failure, warning, or notice.

fields.name: checkSchemaResult
fields.description: Result of traffic validation. This will be null if composition validation was unsuccessful.

fields.name: compositionValidationResult
fields.description: Result of composition validation run before the schema check.

fields.name: diffToPrevious
fields.description: Schema diff and affected operations generated by the schema check

fields.name: targetUrl
fields.description: Generated url to view schema diff in Engine

types.name: CompositionAndRemoveResult
types.description: Metadata about the result of composition run in the cloud, combined with removing an implementing service

fields.name: compositionConfig
fields.description: The produced composition config. Will be null if there are any errors

fields.name: didExist
fields.description: Whether the removed implementing service existed

fields.name: errors
fields.description:
List of errors during composition. Errors mean that Apollo was unable to compose the
graph's implementing services into a GraphQL schema. This partial schema should not be
published to the implementing service if there were any errors encountered

fields.name: graphCompositionID
fields.description: ID that points to the results of composition.

fields.name: updatedGateway
fields.description: Whether the gateway link was updated.

types.name: CompositionAndUpsertResult
types.description: Metadata about the result of composition run in the cloud, combined with implementing service upsert

fields.name: compositionConfig
fields.description: The produced composition config. Will be null if there are any errors

fields.name: errors
fields.description:
List of errors during composition. Errors mean that Apollo was unable to compose the
graph's implementing services into a GraphQL schema. This partial schema should not be
published to the implementing service if there were any errors encountered

fields.name: graphCompositionID
fields.description: ID that points to the results of composition.

fields.name: updatedGateway
fields.description: Whether the gateway link was updated.

fields.name: wasCreated
fields.description: Whether an implementingService was created as part of this mutation

fields.name: wasUpdated
fields.description: Whether an implementingService was updated as part of this mutation

types.name: CompositionConfig
types.description: The composition config exposed to the gateway

fields.name: implementingServiceLocations
fields.description: List of implementing services that comprise a composed graph

fields.name: schemaHash
fields.description: Hash of the composed schema

types.name: CompositionPublishResult
types.description: Metadata about the result of composition run in the cloud

fields.name: compositionConfig
fields.description: The produced composition config. Will be null if there are any errors

fields.name: errors
fields.description:
List of errors during composition. Errors mean that Apollo was unable to compose the
graph's implementing services into a GraphQL schema. This partial schema should not be
published to the implementing service if there were any errors encountered

fields.name: graphCompositionID
fields.description: ID that points to composition result.

fields.name: updatedGateway
fields.description: Whether the gateway link was updated.

types.name: CompositionResult
types.description: Result of a composition, either as the result of a composition validation or a publish.

types.name: CompositionValidationDetails
types.description: The composition config exposed to the gateway

fields.name: implementingServices
fields.description: List of implementing service partial schemas that comprised the graph composed during validation

fields.name: schemaHash
fields.description: Hash of the composed schema

types.name: CompositionValidationResult
types.description: Metadata about the result of compositions validation run in the cloud

fields.name: compositionSuccess
fields.description: Describes whether composition succeeded.

fields.name: compositionValidationDetails
fields.description:
Akin to a composition config, represents the partial schemas and implementing services that were used
in running composition. Will be null if any errors are encountered. Also may contain a schema hash if
one could be computed, which can be used for schema validation.

fields.name: errors
fields.description:
List of errors during composition. Errors mean that Apollo was unable to compose the
graph's implementing services into a GraphQL schema. This partial schema should not be
published to the implementing service if there were any errors encountered

fields.name: graphCompositionID
fields.description: ID that points to the results of this composition.

fields.name: proposedImplementingService
fields.description: The implementing service that was responsible for triggering the validation

fields.name: sparseBuckets
fields.description: Counts per durationBucket, where sequences of zeroes are replaced with the negative of their size

fields.name: activePartialSchema
fields.description:
An implementing service could have multiple inactive partial schemas that were previously uploaded
activePartialSchema returns the one that is designated to be used for composition for a given graph-variant

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Timestamp of when this implementing service was created

fields.name: graphID
fields.description:
Identifies which graph this implementing service belongs to.
Formerly known as "service_id"

fields.name: graphVariant
fields.description:
Specifies which variant of a graph this implementing service belongs to".
Formerly known as "tag"

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the implementing service

fields.name: revision
fields.description:
A way to capture some customer-specific way of tracking which version / edition
of the ImplementingService this is. Typically a Git SHA or docker image ID.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Timestamp for when this implementing service was updated

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL of the graphql endpoint of the implementing service

types.name: FederatedImplementingServicePartialSchema
types.description: A minimal representation of a federated implementing service, using only a name and partial schema SDL

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the implementing service

fields.name: sdl
fields.description: The partial schema of the implementing service

types.name: FederatedImplementingServices
types.description: List of federated implementing services that compose a graph

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: GitContextInput
types.description: This is stored with a schema when it is uploaded

types.name: GraphImplementors
types.description: A union of all combinations that can comprise the implementingServices for a Service

inputFields.name: queryCountThreshold
inputFields.description: Minimum number of requests within the window for a query to be considered.

inputFields.name: queryCountThresholdPercentage
inputFields.description:
Number of requests within the window for a query to be considered, relative to
total request count. Expected values are between 0 and 0.05 (minimum 5% of total
request volume)

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: ImplementingServiceLocation
types.description: The location of the implementing service config file in storage

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the implementing service

fields.name: path
fields.description: The path in storage to access the implementing service config file

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: IntrospectionDirectiveLocation
types.description: __DirectiveLocation introspection type

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

types.name: IntrospectionEnumValue
types.description: Values associated with introspection result for an enum value

types.name: IntrospectionEnumValueInput
types.description: __EnumValue introspection type

types.name: IntrospectionField
types.description: Values associated with introspection result for field

types.name: IntrospectionFieldInput
types.description: __Field introspection type

types.name: IntrospectionInputValue
types.description: Values associated with introspection result for an input field

types.name: IntrospectionInputValueInput
types.description: __Value introspection type

fields.name: fieldCount
fields.deprecationReason:
use the fieldCount on the Schema type, since this field will require a fetch
of the introspection query

fields.name: typeCount
fields.deprecationReason:
use the typeCount on the Schema type, since this field will require a fetch
of the introspection query

types.name: IntrospectionSchemaInput
types.description: __Schema introspection type

types.name: IntrospectionType
types.description: Object containing all possible values for an introspectionType

fields.name: baseKind
fields.description: the base kind of the type this references, ignoring lists and nullability

fields.name: printed
fields.description: printed representation of type, including nested nullability and list ofTypes

types.name: IntrospectionTypeInput
types.description: __Type introspection type

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. 'enumValues' is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. 'inputFields' is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description:
Indicates this type is an interface. 'fields' and 'possibleTypes' are valid
fields

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. 'ofType' is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. 'ofType' is a valid field.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. 'fields' and 'interfaces' are valid fields.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. 'possibleTypes' is a valid field.

types.name: IntrospectionTypeRefInput
types.description: Shallow __Type introspection type

fields.name: accountsRefreshBilling
fields.description: Refresh all accounts from third-party billing service

fields.name: finalizePasswordReset
fields.description:
Finalize a password reset with a token included in the E-mail link,
returns the corresponding login email when successful

fields.description: Join an account with a token

fields.name: plansRefreshBilling
fields.description: Refresh all plans from third-party billing service

fields.name: refreshBilling
fields.description: Refresh all billing information from third-party billing service

fields.name: resetPassword
fields.description: Ask for a user's password to be reset by E-mail

fields.name: setSubscriptions
fields.description: Set the subscriptions for a given email

fields.name: submitPostDeletionFeedback
fields.description: This is called by the form shown to users after they delete their user or organization account.

fields.name: unsubscribeFromAll
fields.description: Unsubscribe a given email from all emails

types.name: NamedIntrospectionType
types.description:
The shared fields for a named introspection type. Currently this is returned for the
top level value affected by a change. In the future, we may update this
type to be an interface, which is extended by the more specific types:
scalar, object, input object, union, interface, and enum

For an in-depth look at where these types come from, see:
https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/blob/659eb50d3/types/graphql/utilities/introspectionQuery.d.ts#L31-L37

types.name: NamedIntrospectionValue
types.description:
Introspection values that can be children of other types for changes, such
as input fields, objects in interfaces, enum values. In the future, this
value could become an interface to allow fields specific to the types
returned.

types.name: NonFederatedImplementingService
types.description: A non-federated service for a monolithic graph

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Timestamp of when this implementing service was created

fields.name: graphID
fields.description:
Identifies which graph this non-implementing service belongs to.
Formerly known as "service_id"

fields.name: graphVariant
fields.description:
Specifies which variant of a graph this implementing service belongs to".
Formerly known as "tag"

types.name: Object
types.description: Arbitrary JSON object

fields.name: body
fields.description: Operation document body

fields.name: name
fields.description: Operation name

types.name: PartialSchema
types.description: Schema for an implementing service with associated metadata

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Timestamp for when the partial schema was created

fields.name: sdl
fields.description: The enriched sdl of a partial schema

fields.name: sdlPath
fields.description: The path of deep storage to find the raw enriched partial schema file

types.name: PartialSchemaInput
types.description:
Input for registering a partial schema to an implementing service.
One of the fields must be specified (validated server-side).

If a new partialSchemaSDL is passed in, this operation will store it before
creating the association.

If both the sdl and hash are specified, an error will be thrown if the provided
hash doesn't match our hash of the sdl contents

inputFields.name: sdl
inputFields.description:
Contents of the partial schema in SDL syntax, but may reference types
that aren't defined in this document

inputFields.name: hash
inputFields.description:
Hash of the partial schema to associate; error is thrown if only the hash is
specified and the hash has not been seen before

fields.name: account
fields.description: Account by ID

fields.name: accountIDAvailable
fields.description: Whether an account ID is available for mutation{newAccount(id:)}

fields.name: allAccounts
fields.description: All accounts

fields.name: allPlans
fields.description: All available plans

fields.name: allServices
fields.description: All services

fields.name: allTimezoneOffsets
fields.description: All timezones with their offsets from UTC

fields.name: allUsers
fields.description: All users

fields.name: asyncError
fields.description: Artificially trigger an error asynchronously

fields.name: emailPreferences
fields.description: Get the unsubscribe settings for a given email.

fields.name: error
fields.description: Artificially trigger an error

fields.name: me
fields.description: Current identity, null if not authenticated

fields.name: plan
fields.description: Look up a plan by ID

fields.name: service
fields.description: Service by ID

fields.name: stats
fields.description:
Query statistics across all services. For admins only; normal users must go
through AccountsStatsWindow or ServiceStatsWindow.

fields.name: user
fields.description: User by ID

types.name: QueryDocumentInput
types.description: query documents to validate against

inputFields.name: engineSignature
inputFields.description: This will be used to link existing records in Engine to a new ID.

fields.name: checkOperations
fields.description: Compare operations to published schema (aside from gitContext):
fields.deprecationReason:
Use checkOperations mutation on ServiceMutation to check operations and
update source control system

fields.name: checkSchema
fields.description:
Compare this schema to a potential replacement, specified by exactly one of the
arguments (aside from gitContext):
fields.deprecationReason:
For new checks to be created, stored, and update the source control system,
use the checkSchema field on ServiceMutation.

fields.name: fieldCount
fields.description: The number of fields; this includes user defined fields only, excluding built-in types and fields

fields.name: typeCount
fields.description: The number of types; this includes user defined types only, excluding built-in types

types.name: SchemaCompositionError
types.description: Represents an error from running schema composition on a list of service definitions.

fields.name: affectedClients
fields.description: Clients affected by all changes in diff

fields.name: affectedQueries
fields.description: Operations affected by all changes in diff

fields.name: changes
fields.description: List of schema changes with associated affected clients and operations

fields.name: numberOfCheckedOperations
fields.description: Number of operations that were validated during schema diff

fields.name: severity
fields.description: Indication of the success of the change, either failure, warning, or notice.

fields.name: tag
fields.description: The tag against which this diff was created

fields.name: validationConfig
fields.description: Configuration of validation

fields.name: from
fields.description:
delta in seconds from current time that determines the start of the window
for reported metrics included in a schema diff. A day window from the present
day would have a \`from\` value of -86400. In rare cases, this could be an ISO
timestamp if the user passed one in on diff creation

fields.name: queryCountThreshold
fields.description: Minimum number of requests within the window for a query to be considered.

fields.name: queryCountThresholdPercentage
fields.description:
Number of requests within the window for a query to be considered, relative to
total request count. Expected values are between 0 and 0.05 (minimum 5% of
total request volume)

fields.name: to
fields.description:
delta in seconds from current time that determines the end of the
window for reported metrics included in a schema diff. A day window
from the present day would have a \`to\` value of -0. In rare
cases, this could be an ISO timestamp if the user passed one in on diff
creation

fields.name: history
fields.description:
List of previously uploaded SchemaTags under the same tag name, not including
the latest one. Sorted in reverse chronological order by creation date (newest
publish first).

Note: This does not include the history of checked schemas

fields.name: historyLength
fields.description:
Number of tagged schemas created under the same tag name, not including the current
active schema; Also represents the maximum size of the history's limit argument.

fields.name: historyOrder
fields.description:
Number of schemas tagged prior to this one under the same tag name, its position
in the tag history.

fields.name: publishedAt
fields.description:
Indicates this schema is "published" meaning that our users correspond this schema
with a long-running or permanent initiative. Published schemas appear in the UI
when exploring a service's schemas, and typically refer to either active environments
with metrics (e.g. "staging") or git branches that are constantly used as a base
(e.g. "master"). If this field is not found, the schema is "private" to Engine
and is uploaded but not promoted to published yet. The other benefit is this makes
for nice UX around publishing events

fields.name: reversionFrom
fields.description:
Indicates the schemaTag of the schema's original upload, null if this is the
first upload of the schema.

fields.name: compositionResultById
fields.description: Given a graphCompositionID, return the results of composition. This can represent either a validation or a publish.

fields.name: implementingServices
fields.description:
List of implementing services that comprise a graph. A non-federated graph should have a single implementing service.
Set includeDeleted to see deleted implementing services

fields.name: lastUsedOperation
fields.description: For a particular field, that last time it was used, within a time period. Defaults to a time period of the last 30 days.

fields.name: mostRecentCompositionPublish
fields.description:
This returns the composition result that was most recently published to the graph.
Only identites that canQuerySchemas and canQueryImplementingServices have access
to this field

fields.name: queryTriggers
fields.description: Get query triggers for a given variant. If variant is null all the triggers for this service will be gotten.

fields.name: roles
fields.description: Which permissions the current user has for interacting with this service

fields.name: schema
fields.description: Get a schema by hash OR current tag

fields.name: schemaTag
fields.description:
Get the schema tag created at or most recently before a specified date. Returns
latest tag by default.

fields.name: schemaTags
fields.description:
Get schema tags, with optional filtering to a set of tags. Always sorted by creation
date in reverse chronological order.

fields.name: checkPartialSchema
fields.description:
Compose an implementing service's partial schema, diff the composed schema, validate traffic against that schema,
and store the result so the details can be viewed by users in the UI.
This mutation will not mark the schema as "published".

args.name: frontend
args.description:
Basename of the frontend for URL generation.
If composition is successful; this will point to
\`\${basename}/service/engine/checks?schemaTagId=\${schemaTagId}\`.
If composition is unsuccessful, this will point to
\`\${basename}/service/engine/checks?graphCompositionID=\${graphCompositionID}\`

args.name: graphVariant
args.description: Specifies which variant of a graph this mutation operates on.

args.name: implementingServiceName
args.description: Name of the implementing service to validate the partial schema against

args.name: partialSchema
args.description: The partial schema to validate against an implementing service

args.name: useMaximumRetention
args.description:
Whether to use the maximum retention for historical validation. This only takes
effect if historicParameters is null.

fields.name: checkSchema
fields.description:
Checks a proposed schema against the schema that has been published to
a particular tag, using metrics that have been published to the base tag.
Callers can set the historicParameters directly, which will be used if
provided. If useMaximumRetention is provided, but historicParameters is not,
then validation will use the maximum retention the graph has access to.
If neither historicParameters nor useMaximumRetention is provided, the
default time range of one week (7 days) will be used.

fields.name: createApiKeyAndWriteStorageSecret
fields.description:
Create a new API key and also write the storage secret for that API key.
The storage secret allows users to fetch files from GCS like operation manifests and composition artifacts for federation.
Storage secrets need to be accessible via a service's API key, so we need to
couple the creation of these files with API key creation

fields.name: deleteQueryTrigger
fields.description: Delete an existing query trigger

fields.name: recalculateCompositionConfig
fields.description:
Manually triggers composition.
An error will be thrown if a graphVariant does not contain any implementing services.
Users might not want to recalculate the composition config every time an
The gateway won't be updated if there are errors or warnings. If no errors or warnings are
present, then the gateway will be updated to have a new composition config and the composed
schema corresponding to the new composition config will registered to the graphVariant. If
there are no changes that haven't been shipped to the gateway, everything will be undefined
and errors and warnings will be empty.

args.name: graphVariant
args.description:
Specifies which variant of a graph these operations belong to.
Formerly known as "tag"
Defaults to "current"

args.name: graphVariant
args.description:
Specifies which variant of a graph these operations belong to.
Formerly known as "tag"
Defaults to "current"

fields.name: updateDatadogMetricsConfig
fields.description: Update datadog configuration

fields.name: validatePartialSchemaOfImplementingServiceAgainstGraph
fields.description:
This mutation will not result in any changes to the implementing service
Run composition with the Implementing Service's partial schema replaced with the one provided
in the mutation's input. Store the composed schema, return the hash of the composed schema,
and any warnings and errors pertaining to composition.
This mutation will not run validation against operations.

types.name: ServiceRoles
types.description: A map from role (permission) String to boolean that the current user is allowed for the root service

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Timestamp
types.description: ISO 8601, extended format with nanoseconds, Zulu (or '[+-]seconds' for times relative to now)

types.name: TypeFilterConfig
types.description:
the TypeFilterConfig is used to isolate
types, and subsequent fields, through
various configuration settings.

It defaults to filter towards user defined
types only

inputFields.name: includeBuiltInTypes
inputFields.description: include built in scalars (i.e. Boolean, Int, etc)

fields.name: gcs
fields.description: A GCS URI

types.name: UploadPartialSchemaResponse
types.description: Response from uploading a partial schema

fields.name: partialSchemaHash
fields.description: Hash of the partial schema

fields.name: implementingService
fields.description: The upserted implementing service

fields.name: wasCreated
fields.description: Boolean value that indicates whether the implementing service was created

fields.name: wasUpdated
fields.description: Boolean value that indicates where the implementing service was updated

fields.name: internalAdminRole
fields.description:
This role is reserved exclusively for internal MDG employees, and it controls what access they may have to other
organizations within Graph Manager. Only admins are allowed to see this field.

fields.name: lastAuthenticatedAt
fields.description: Last time any API token from this user was used against AGM services

fields.name: changePassword
fields.description: Change the user's password

fields.name: hardDelete
fields.description: Hard deletes the associated user. Throws an error otherwise with reason included.

fields.name: newKey
fields.description: Create a new API key for this user. Must take in a name for this key.

fields.name: provisionKey
fields.description:
Create a new API key for this user if there are no current API keys.
If an API key already exists, this will return one at random and not create a new one.

fields.name: refresh
fields.description: Refresh information about the user from its upstream service (eg list of organizations from GitHub)

fields.name: removeKey
fields.description: Removes the given key from this user. Can be used to remove either a web cookie or a user API key.

fields.name: renameKey
fields.description: Renames the given key to the new key name.

fields.name: update
fields.description: Update information about a user; all arguments are optional

fields.name: updateRole
fields.description:
Update user to have the given internal mdg admin role.
It is necessary to be an MDG_INTERNAL_SUPER_ADMIN to perform update.
Additionally, upserting a null value explicitly revokes this user's
admin status.

types.name: ValidationResult
types.description:
Represents a single validation error, with information relating to the error
and its respective operation

fields.name: code
fields.description: The validation result's error code

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the validation error

fields.name: operation
fields.description: The operation related to this validation result

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of validation error thrown - warning, failure, or invalid.

types.name: Void
types.description: Always null

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
